edu.vserver.exercises.model
Interface SubmissionVisualizer<E extends ExerciseData,S extends SubmissionInfo>

Type Parameters:
E - ExerciseData of the exercise type submissions to which can be visualized by the implementor
S - SubmissionInfo -data object that can be visualized by the implementor
All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
ExerTypeVoidImplCollection.VoidSubmissionVisualizer
public interface SubmissionVisualizer<E extends ExerciseData,S extends SubmissionInfo>
extends java.io.Serializable

An implementor of this class knows how to visualize certain submission stored as SubmissionInfo made to a given exercise (ExerciseData ).

Author:
Riku Haavisto, Johannes Holvitie

Method Summary
 java.lang.String exportSubmissionDataAsText()
           
 Component getView()
           
 void initialize(E exercise, S dataObject, ResourceGiver localizer, ExerciseMaterialManager matManager)
          Loads the visualizer with data.
 

Method Detail

initialize

void initialize(E exercise,
                S dataObject,
                ResourceGiver localizer,
                ExerciseMaterialManager matManager)
                throws ExerciseException
Loads the visualizer with data. This method must be called before calling other methods of the visualizer. The method initializes the visualizer.

Parameters:
exercise - ExerciseData object to be loaded for the visualizer; this is the exercise the submission was made to
dataObject - SubmissionInfo of the submission made to given exercise that is going to be visualized
localizer - ResourceGiver making it possible to localize UI
matManager - ExerciseMaterialManager giving all the ExerciseMaterials that might be attached to this exercise-instance and thus needed for correct visulization
Throws:
ExerciseException

getView

Component getView()
Returns:
The GUI that visualizes the submission

exportSubmissionDataAsText

java.lang.String exportSubmissionDataAsText()
Returns:
The submission presented as a string (might be for example the programming code a student used in a programming exercise)
